question: At the beginning of the meeting, there were 55 engineers and 17 doctors. After an hour, 1/6 of the total number of people left. How many doctors are left if 16 engineers stayed at the meeting?
answer:
There were a total of 55 engineers + 17 doctors = <<55+17=72>>72 people who attended the meeting.
After an hour, 72 people * 1/6 = <<72*1/6=12>>12 people left the meeting.
This means 72 people - 12 people = <<72-12=60>>60 people stayed.
Out of the 60 who stayed, 60 people - 16 engineers = <<60-16=44>>44 were doctors.
#### 44
